modules.description: This module implements communication channels over Xen virtual channels, supporting server and client endpoints for inter-domain communication. It provides functions to establish connections, read and write data using `Cstruct.t` buffers, and manage connection lifecycle with shutdown and close operations. Concrete use cases include secure, low-level data transfer between virtual machines in a Xen hypervisor environment, such as device emulation or guest-to-host control messaging.

This module manages event channels and ports for inter-domain communication in a Xen environment. It supports operations to send and receive events, listen on and connect to ports, and close channels, working with specific types for ports, channels, and events. Use cases include coordinating domain wakeups and handling event notifications between virtual domains.

This module manages memory sharing and mapping operations for Xen guests. It provides functions to convert between integer identifiers and memory grants, share and unshare memory regions with other domains, and map or unmap memory for direct access. It works with data types representing memory grants, shared memory regions, and mapped memory buffers, supporting use cases like inter-domain communication and device emulation.
